alert.note: Alert for Western Arctic Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 04 at 10:10PM AKST until December 05 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Strong winds occuring, with brief blizzard conditions expected. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 65 mph. * WHERE...Western Arctic Coast. * WHEN...Until noon AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Strong winds could cause damage to building and power lines. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds gusting to 75 mph are occuring at Cape Lisburne. Strong winds to 65 mph are expected to spread to Point Lay and Wainwright early Monday morning. Snow is possible Monday morning, and if snow does occur blizzard conditions will occur as well. Winds are expected to decrease Monday afternoon.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. This will make travel very difficult or impossible.
